It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant produces small, yellow berries that contain toxic compounds, making it harmful to humans and animals. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
